Очень сильно устарел геймдизайн, одни eбучие лабиринты; полно пустых комнат, которые очень старательно сбивают тебя с основного пути; полно багов, когда ты застреваешь в текстурах; слишком много нового и ненужного вооружения: новая пушка буквально через комнату, меня к середине уже тошнило от этих всяких зеновских каломётов. 

Если Half Life 1 ещё и можно пройти, получая какое-никакое удовольствие, то этот кусок запылившегося кода лучше даже палкой не тыкать.

Well, Half-Life (Opposing Force) is like any other game. Either you like it or you hate it.

[b]One shouldn't forget that the game is from 1998 / 1999 and is therefore one of the really old games.[/b]
Due to the age, it is of course absolutely not comparable with current games, even if they are retro games. Whether they are created from scratch and with a retro look, or are simply technically polished, a Half-Life will always play differently than "younger" games.

I'm a total Half Life fan. It's no secret and I don't make any of it.
This is probably due to my age and the fact that I played the game for hours after it was released. I even have the packaging with CD-ROM somewhere (if anyone else knows 😉)

As far as I know, [b]Opposing Force is one of the first add-ons[/b] for half-Life.
[b]The story[/b] about Black Mesa and the planet Xen [b]is (almost) the same here[/b], but this time you don't experience the events from Gordon Freeman's point of view, but as [b]soldier Adrian Shephard whose job it is to hunt down scientist Gordon Freeman.[/b]

At the beginning of the story you are on your own as usual, but this changes as the game progresses. 
With their different abilities, the scattered soldiers form a team that can act together from now on, as long as the AI plays along. 
Unfortunately, it happens every now and then that you run into a room full of aliens alone and the AI comrades-in-arms are standing around somewhere else.
Nevertheless, the presence of the teammates pays off because you have the option, for example, to always have a medic on the team or another team member who welds open locked doors.

[b]In terms of action, the add-on is in no way inferior to the main game.[/b]

Only for younger or new Half-Life players there may be an issue (as mentioned in my [url= https://steamcommunity.com/id/omn1cron/recommended/70/]Half-Life review[/url]) that the game feels or plays "weird".

[b]In my opinion, the add-on is a must-have for die-hard fans.[/b]

✅ absolutely gripping story
✅ Great level design
✅ breathtaking atmosphere
✅ Pure excitement

❌ basically too old

初次进入游戏记得打开鼠标选项的Raw mouse input，并且在锁定大写的情况下玩，以防游戏闪退。本作与第一部正片发生在同一时间，用不同视角叙述了同一个故事，然而质量竟然比正传还要好！武器更多，还能碰到正传里没有的敌人，主角老谢是HECU部队一员，就是来灭口的军队，然后不知不觉就一脚踏进了地狱般的三方大混战，这部游戏部分设定与正传不符，所以部分情节至今未被官方承认，所以最强队员谢泼德至今下落不明。

Most of my pals and I hadn't played Opposing Force, because 20 years ago,  it wasn't easy to get your hands on an Expansion Pack, at least where I lived. I had played Half Life, but never got to try this. I had it on Steam for years, but never felt like playing it because it was too old, I already knew the story. Until now though, I wanted to give it a shot a couple of days ago and boy I was not disappointed. It felt fun, it had a good singleplayer experience unlike the contemporary games. The story was captivating too, I honestly feel Adrian Shephard (the protagonist) is underused in Half Life series, I hope he'll be a recurring character in upcoming Half Life sequeahaahahahhahahahah just kidding there will be no 3rd.

If you like Half-Life, you'll like Opposing Force. It's Half-Life but you play as Adrian Shepherd, a HECU Marine who's been sent in to clean up the Black Mesa incident. This expansion has many new weapons, from a Desert  Eagle with a laser attached to a barnacle that you can use to grapple around, this game definitely improves upon the weapons in the original. However, what good are new weapons without any bad guys to shoot with them? To answer that question, we have Race X, a whole new type of mysterious aliens from somewhere other than Xen. Because you're a marine and you can't just shoot other marines, you fight the Black Ops now, just reskinned marines pretty much. If you like Half-Life, go get this. You need it!
"Why are you hurting scientists?!" -Adrian Shepard
Good, worthy "expansion" to the original Half-Life, albeit shorter (though not as short as my logged playtime would suggest)

Honestly, I might have enjoyed this even more than the base game for Half-Life. Nonstop action, new weapons, and a much more straight- forward plot.

This is definitely the best of the Gearbox Half-Life DLC expansions. Whereas Blue Shift and Decay (that one weird multiplayer only PlayStation 2 exclusive) feel like short addons, Opposing Force is closer to a full-fledged game. The new weapons and mechanics gave enough gameplay diversity to feel fresh, while still maintaining that distinct Half-Life feeling. 

8.5/10: highly recommend

Wait, Gearbox made this? It's actually a good game?
Yes and yes, Opposing Force is as it sounds, puts you in the position of a HECU grunt during the half life campaign. It's not a particularly long game but what you get is a few new weapons, new enemies, and a few new mechanics (like ropes and units, who you will probably kill pretty quickly for the heck of it).

An interesting piece of work from Gearbox, bringing their typical stereotype based script and comic style, but I don't feel like this added much to the franchise. Yet I can't not recommend it, especially if you want to meet Crawmerax the Invincible and see the vault for the first time (Borderlands). Honestly, I am pretty convinced this is the first iteration of Borderlands.
